title: Prophile on DiGiT
historical_context: This article provides a personal insight into the life and experiences of a hacker known as DiGiT, reflecting the hacker culture of the late 1990s and early 2000s.
target_audience: Hackers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture.
short_summary: The article is an interview-style profile of DiGiT, detailing his background, experiences in hacking, and thoughts on the hacker scene, including the commercialization of hacking and the concept of full disclosure.
summary:
In this engaging profile, DiGiT shares his journey into the world of hacking, starting from his early experiences with computers and IRC. He discusses the thrill of discovering and exploiting vulnerabilities, as well as the camaraderie formed with fellow hackers. DiGiT reflects on memorable experiences, including his encounters with notable figures in the hacking community and the impact of various events on his life. He expresses a strong preference for independence and self-direction, emphasizing the importance of personal goals in his hacking pursuits.

The article also delves into DiGiT's views on the commercialization of hacking, particularly the implications of full disclosure policies. He critiques the motivations behind publicizing exploits, suggesting that many do so for fame and financial gain rather than the greater good. DiGiT argues that full disclosure can lead to negative consequences, such as the proliferation of exploits among less skilled individuals. Overall, this profile captures the essence of hacker culture during a transformative period, providing valuable insights into the mindset and experiences of a hacker deeply embedded in the scene.
